Properties.ProtectedString:
Tool = script.Parent
local stillEquipped = false
function onEquippedLocal(mouse) stillEquipped = true if mouse == nil then print("Mouse not found") return end while stillEquipped do print("Setting Mouse to go") mouse.Icon = "rbxasset://textures\\GunCursor.png" while Tool.Enabled and stillEquipped do wait(0.01) end print("Setting Mouse to wait") mouse.Icon = "rbxasset://textures\\GunWaitCursor.png" while not Tool.Enabled and stillEquipped do wait(0.01) end end end
function onUnequippedLocal() stillEquipped = false end
Tool.Equipped:connect(onEquippedLocal) Tool.Unequipped:connect(onUnequippedLocal)

math.randomseed(tick())
local Tool = script.Parent local Sword = Tool.Handle
local myCharacter local myPlayer local myHumanoid local myTorso local myRightArm local myRightGrip
local debris = game:GetService("Debris") local runServ = game:GetService("RunService")
local SlashSound = Instance.new("Sound") SlashSound.SoundId = "rbxasset://sounds\\SwordSlash.wav" SlashSound.Parent = Tool SlashSound.Volume = .7 local unsheathSound = Instance.new("Sound") unsheathSound.SoundId = "rbxasset://sounds\\unsheath.wav" unsheathSound.Parent = Sword unsheathSound.Volume = 0.7
local activeAnim local activeSound
local lastAttackTime = 0 local thisAttackTime
local randNum
local DamageDeterminer -- Keeping track of which damage to apply is hard; I'm using an IntValue to do it.
local TOUCH_DAMAGE = 5 local SLASH_DAMAGE = 9 local SPIKES_DAMAGE = 12 local SAW_DAMAGE = 10 local allDamages = {} allDamages[1] = SLASH_DAMAGE allDamages[2] = SPIKES_DAMAGE allDamages[3] = SAW_DAMAGE
Tool.Enabled = true
function tagHumanoid(humanoid, player) if humanoid ~= nil then creator = Instance.new("ObjectValue") creator.Name = "creator" creator.Value = player creator.Parent = humanoid debris:addItem(creator, 1) end end
function untagHumanoid(humanoid) if humanoid ~= nil then local creatorTag = humanoid:FindFirstChild("creator") if creatorTag then creatorTag:Remove() end end end
function slow(humanoid) if humanoid.Parent == nil then return end local slowScript = humanoid.Parent:FindFirstChild("SawSlowScript") if slowScript == nil then if Tool:FindFirstChild("SawSlowScript") ~= nil then slowScript = Tool.SawSlowScript:Clone() slowScript.Parent = humanoid.Parent slowScript.Disabled = false end end end
function instantiateDamageDet(value) DamageDeterminer = Tool:FindFirstChild("DamageDeterminer") if DamageDeterminer then DamageDeterminer:Remove() end
DamageDeterminer = Instance.new("IntValue") DamageDeterminer.Name = "DamageDeterminer" DamageDeterminer.Parent= Tool DamageDeterminer.Value = value
if (value == 1 or value == 2) then debris:AddItem(DamageDeterminer, 0.5) else --value == 3, i.e. it's a saw debris:AddItem(DamageDeterminer, 2.5) end end
function damageHumanoid(humanoid) DamageDeterminer = Tool:FindFirstChild("DamageDeterminer") if (DamageDeterminer == nil) then humanoid:TakeDamage(TOUCH_DAMAGE) else humanoid:TakeDamage(allDamages[DamageDeterminer.Value]) slow(humanoid) end end
function blow(hit) if hit.Parent then local hitHumanoid = hit.Parent:FindFirstChild("Humanoid") myCharacter = Tool.Parent myHumanoid = myCharacter:FindFirstChild("Humanoid") myPlayer = game.Players:GetPlayerFromCharacter(myCharacter) if hitHumanoid ~= nil and myHumanoid ~= nil and myHumanoid ~= hitHumanoid then myRightArm = myCharacter:FindFirstChild("Right Arm") if myRightArm then myRightGrip = myRightArm:FindFirstChild("RightGrip") if myRightGrip and (myRightGrip.Part0 == Sword or myRightGrip.Part1 == Sword) then tagHumanoid(hitHumanoid, myPlayer) damageHumanoid(hitHumanoid) wait(1) untagHumanoid(hitHumanoid) end end end end end
function slash() instantiateDamageDet(1)
if activeSound then activeSound:Play() end if activeAnim then activeAnim:Play() end
end
function spikes() instantiateDamageDet(2)
if activeAnim then activeAnim:Play() end if activeSound then activeSound:Play() end
end
function saw() instantiateDamageDet(3)
if activeSound then activeSound:Play() end if activeAnim then activeAnim:Play() end wait(2.5)
end
function onActivated() -- Checking for double clicks is based on the sword standard.
-- Check that tool is enabled, if not Tool.Enabled then return end Tool.Enabled = false -- And that character has use of his right arm. myCharacter = Tool.Parent if not myCharacter then return end myHumanoid = myCharacter:FindFirstChild("Humanoid") if not myHumanoid then return end RightArm = myCharacter:FindFirstChild("Right Arm") if not RightArm then return end
if activeAnim then activeAnim:Stop() end if activeSound then activeSound:Stop() end
-- Get the time, to determine whether it was a double click or not. thisAttackTime = runServ.Stepped:wait()
if (thisAttackTime - lastAttackTime < 0.2) then -- It was a double click. activeAnim = myHumanoid:LoadAnimation(Tool.Bonesaw) activeSound = Tool:FindFirstChild("SawSound") saw() else -- It was a single click. randNum = math.random(1, 3) if (randNum < 3) then if (randNum < 2) then activeAnim = myHumanoid:LoadAnimation(Tool.Slash) else activeAnim = myHumanoid:LoadAnimation(Tool.RightSlash) end activeSound = SlashSound slash() else activeAnim = myHumanoid:LoadAnimation(Tool.SpikesToFace) activeSound = Tool:FindFirstChild("SpikePunchSound") spikes() end end
lastAttackTime = thisAttackTime Tool.Enabled = true end
function onEquipped() if unsheathSound then unsheathSound:Play() end end
function onUnequipped() if activeSound then activeSound:Stop() end if unsheathSound then unsheathSound:Stop() end if activeAnim then activeAnim:Stop() end end
Tool.Activated:connect(onActivated) Tool.Equipped:connect(onEquipped) Tool.Unequipped:connect(onUnequipped)
Sword.Touched:connect(blow)

Humanoid = script.Parent:FindFirstChild("Humanoid") if not Humanoid then script:Remove() end
for i = 1, 5 do Humanoid:TakeDamage(4) Humanoid.WalkSpeed = Humanoid.WalkSpeed - 2 wait(1) end
Humanoid.WalkSpeed = 16 script:Remove()
